title: Kristen Bell explains why she and husband Dax Shepard don't remember their anniversary
text:
CLOSE Years before Dax Shepard and Kristen Bell tied the knot, the actor admittedly "wasn't certain" he wanted to be with the virtuous star of "The Good Place." Time

Honestly, if you don't know when Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard's anniversary is, it's OK –because neither do they.

The "Frozen" actress confessed in an Instagram tribute to her husband on Monday that neither of them can remember their anniversary date, which they think happened "at some point last week."

"We were reminded by family and friends that at some point last week, it was our 5 year wedding anniversary," she wrote, captioning a photo of Shepard with his arm around her. "In truth, neither of us remember which day. Thats because we have been living the celebration of our commitment every moment since."

According to Bell, memories are more important to them than numbers.

"I find when you are living with gratitude each moment, the dates become irrelevant," she continued. "To get to wake up next to someone who has put hard work, respectful fights, patience, understanding and gratitude into your relationship is the definition of love."

More: Kristen Bell, Dax Shepard have hilarious clap back to tabloid rumors about their marriage

More: Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard get real about married life: 'This isn't a special fairytale'

The 39-year-old capped off her post saying she'll "never remember the date" of her anniversary and her 44-year-old husband "won't either."

"And thats just one more thing i love about us," she concluded.

And the kicker? Last week wasn't even their fifth anniversary. It was their sixth.

More: Dax Shepard reveals he 'wasn't certain' he wanted to be with wife Kristen Bell

A helpful fan pointed this out to Bell in one of the comments.

"Mom, I think it was 6! Case in point, all love," the user wrote, adding a heart emoji.

The observation seemed to take Bell by surprise.

"hahahah oops, your right it was 6yrs!!!!!" she replied, adding three clapping emojis.

Guess time flies when you're in love.
